portal.title: Claude Mastery Path
portal.subtitle: An 8-step journey from AI beginner to Claude expert — covering AI fundamentals, prompting, Claude.ai features, professional workflows, and Claude Code. All videos sourced exclusively from official Anthropic channels.
portal.audience: All employees — from first-time AI users to advanced practitioners

steps.title: AI & Claude Fundamentals
steps.summary: Build a solid foundation: understand what AI is, how large language models work, what Claude can and cannot do, and how to use AI responsibly.
objectives: Understand what generative AI is and how it differs from traditional software
Recognize Claude's key capabilities and limitations
Apply responsible AI practices around data privacy and diligence
Explain why AI Fluency matters for your career and organization
checklist: Complete all 6 videos in this step
Identify two tasks in your current role where AI could add value
Review your organization's AI and data privacy policy
Complete the quiz for each video with ≥ 80% accuracy

topics.title: Introduction to AI
topics.description: Structured lessons from Anthropic's AI Fluency course — covering why AI fluency matters, how generative AI works, and what to expect from tools like Claude.

videos.title: Lesson 1: Introduction to AI Fluency
videos.reason: Lesson 1: Introduction to AI Fluency

questions.question: What is the primary goal of AI Fluency as introduced in this course?
choices: To replace traditional job skills with AI skills
To collaborate effectively, efficiently, ethically, and safely with AI
To learn how to program AI models
To automate all workplace tasks
questions.explanation: AI Fluency is about learning to collaborate with AI systems effectively, efficiently, ethically, and safely — not about automating everything or replacing skills.

questions.question: According to the introduction, AI Fluency is relevant for:
choices: Only software engineers and data scientists
Only managers and executives
Anyone who wants to work effectively alongside AI tools
Only people in technical roles
questions.explanation: AI Fluency is designed for anyone who interacts with AI in their work, regardless of technical background.

questions.question: What does developing AI Fluency primarily help you do?
choices: Build your own AI models from scratch
Use AI tools more critically and effectively in your daily work
Avoid using AI tools altogether
Become an AI researcher
questions.explanation: AI Fluency helps you use AI tools more critically and effectively — understanding when and how to use them, and when to rely on human judgment.

videos.title: Lesson 2A: Why do we need AI Fluency?
videos.reason: Lesson 2A: Why do we need AI Fluency?

questions.question: Why is AI Fluency increasingly important in today's workplace?
choices: Because AI will soon replace all human workers
Because AI tools are now widely accessible and impact many jobs
Because governments require AI certification
Because traditional skills are no longer valued
questions.explanation: AI tools have become widely accessible and are impacting many professions, making it important to understand how to work alongside them effectively.

questions.question: What risk does using AI without proper fluency create?
choices: Your computer will break down
You may produce poor-quality outputs or make uninformed decisions
AI will stop working for you
You will be charged more for the service
questions.explanation: Without AI Fluency, users risk accepting incorrect outputs, making poor decisions, or missing opportunities to leverage AI effectively.

questions.question: How does AI Fluency benefit professionals in their careers?
choices: It guarantees a promotion
It replaces the need for domain expertise
It enables them to work smarter and stay competitive as AI transforms industries
It eliminates the need to learn new skills
questions.explanation: AI Fluency helps professionals work smarter, adapt to changes in their industry, and remain competitive as AI becomes more prevalent.

videos.title: Lesson 3A: What is generative AI? (Deep Dive)
videos.reason: Lesson 3A: What is generative AI? (Deep Dive)

questions.question: What makes generative AI different from traditional software?
choices: It can only perform calculations
It generates new content rather than following fixed rules
It requires internet access to function
It can only process numbers
questions.explanation: Unlike traditional software that follows fixed rules, generative AI creates new content by learning patterns from large amounts of data.

questions.question: What does a language model like Claude predict when generating a response?
choices: The exact answer from a database
The most likely next word or token based on context
A random word from the dictionary
The answer from the most recent Wikipedia edit
questions.explanation: Large language models work by predicting the most probable next token given the context, which is how they generate coherent text.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes how generative AI learns?
choices: It memorizes a fixed database of answers
It learns by training on large amounts of text and data
It is programmed with explicit rules for every situation
It learns only from the current conversation
questions.explanation: Generative AI models are trained on massive datasets, learning patterns to generate relevant and coherent outputs.

videos.title: Lesson 3B: Capabilities & limitations
videos.reason: Lesson 3B: Capabilities & limitations

questions.question: Which of the following is a known limitation of generative AI like Claude?
choices: It cannot process text
It may generate plausible-sounding but incorrect information (hallucinations)
It cannot understand questions
It only works in English
questions.explanation: A key limitation of generative AI is hallucination — generating confident-sounding information that is factually incorrect. Always verify important claims.

questions.question: What is one of Claude's key strengths?
choices: Accessing real-time internet data
Writing, analysis, summarization, and reasoning across diverse topics
Running computer programs autonomously
Replacing human decision-making entirely
questions.explanation: Claude excels at writing, analysis, summarization, and reasoning — making it a powerful assistant for knowledge work across many domains.

questions.question: Why is it important to verify AI-generated information?
choices: Because AI is always wrong
Because AI can produce errors and may have outdated knowledge
Because AI intentionally misleads users
Because AI responses are always incomplete
questions.explanation: AI models can produce errors and their training data has a cutoff date. Verification is essential for important decisions.

topics.title: Responsible AI Use
topics.description: Understand data privacy, how to protect sensitive information, and why applying diligence — verifying AI outputs — is essential in any professional context.

videos.title: Understanding privacy and data
videos.reason: Understanding privacy and data

questions.question: What type of data should you be most careful about sharing with AI systems?
choices: General industry news
Confidential personal or business information
Publicly available facts
General writing prompts
questions.explanation: Confidential, sensitive, or personal data should be handled with great care when using AI tools.

questions.question: What is a best practice when working with sensitive business data in Claude?
choices: Share all data to get the most accurate response
Anonymize or remove identifying information before sharing
Only use Claude on personal computers
Always use Claude in incognito mode
questions.explanation: Before sharing sensitive data with any AI tool, anonymize or remove identifying information to protect privacy.

questions.question: Why does data privacy matter when using AI tools professionally?
choices: It doesn't matter since AI is always confidential
To comply with regulations, protect individuals, and maintain organizational trust
Only because IT departments require it
Only when working with financial data
questions.explanation: Privacy matters for legal compliance, protecting individuals' rights, and maintaining the trust of clients and colleagues.

videos.title: Lesson 10: A closer look at Diligence
videos.reason: Lesson 10: A closer look at Diligence

questions.question: In the 4D Framework, what does "Diligence" primarily involve?
choices: Writing longer prompts
Critically reviewing and verifying AI outputs before using them
Using AI as fast as possible
Sharing AI outputs without modification
questions.explanation: Diligence means taking responsibility for reviewing, verifying, and critically evaluating AI-generated content before acting on it.

questions.question: Why is it important to apply Diligence when using AI for factual tasks?
choices: Because AI is always wrong
Because AI can make errors and you are responsible for the final output
Because AI slows down when you trust it too much
Because regulators require it in all cases
questions.explanation: You are ultimately responsible for any output you use or share. AI can make mistakes, so applying diligence protects quality and accuracy.

questions.question: Which practice best demonstrates Diligence in an AI workflow?
choices: Copying AI responses directly into final documents
Fact-checking AI-generated claims using authoritative sources
Asking AI the same question multiple times
Only using AI for creative tasks
questions.explanation: Fact-checking AI-generated claims using reliable sources is the essence of Diligence — ensuring outputs are accurate before they influence decisions.

steps.title: Getting Started with Claude.ai
steps.summary: Set up your Claude account, have your first conversations, and master the four core features: Artifacts, Projects, Connectors, and Skills.
objectives: Navigate Claude.ai confidently and start productive conversations
Use Claude as an active thinking partner, not just a Q&A tool
Create and iterate on Artifacts for documents, code, and interactive content
Use Projects to maintain persistent context across sessions
Connect external tools via Connectors and create custom Skills
checklist: Sign in to Claude.ai and complete your first conversation
Try using Claude as a thinking partner on a real problem
Create one Artifact (document or interactive HTML)
Set up a Project with a custom instruction
Create a Skill based on a recurring task you do

topics.title: First Conversations
topics.description: Get started with Claude.ai, discover how to use it as a thinking partner, and understand the capabilities of Claude Sonnet.

videos.title: Getting started with Claude.ai
videos.reason: Official walkthrough covering account setup, the chat interface, and your first prompts — the essential starting point for all learners.

questions.question: What is Claude primarily designed to do?
choices: Search the web and return links
Assist with writing, analysis, coding, and research through conversation
Compile and run programming code
Manage social media accounts
questions.explanation: Claude is Anthropic's conversational AI assistant, built to help with a wide range of tasks including writing, analysis, research, and coding — all through natural language.

questions.question: True or False: Claude retains memory of previous conversations by default.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: By default, Claude does not remember previous conversations. Each new chat starts fresh. Projects are the feature that allows context to persist across sessions.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT something Claude can do?
choices: Write and edit documents
Generate images from text descriptions
Analyze uploaded files
Help debug code
questions.explanation: Claude is a text-based AI and cannot generate images. For image generation you would need a separate tool like Midjourney or DALL-E.

videos.title: Turning Claude into your thinking partner
videos.reason: Turning Claude into your thinking partner

questions.question: What is the key approach for turning Claude into an effective thinking partner?
choices: Using Claude only for final polished outputs
Engaging Claude in iterative dialogue to explore and refine ideas
Asking Claude only yes/no questions
Giving Claude very short, simple prompts
questions.explanation: Claude works best as a thinking partner through iterative dialogue — sharing your reasoning, asking for pushback, and refining ideas together.

questions.question: How should you treat Claude when working through complex problems?
choices: As a search engine for quick answers
As a collaborative partner you can think out loud with
As a replacement for human colleagues
As an automated report generator
questions.explanation: Treating Claude as a collaborative thinking partner — sharing context, asking for different perspectives — leads to much richer outcomes.

questions.question: What distinguishes using Claude as a thinking partner from using it as a Q&A tool?
choices: Thinking partners require paid subscriptions
Iterative back-and-forth that develops ideas progressively
Providing Claude with no context
Asking only factual questions
questions.explanation: A thinking partner relationship involves ongoing dialogue, sharing context, and building on responses — unlike simple one-off Q&A.

videos.title: Getting the most out of Sonnet 4.5 in Claude.ai
videos.reason: Explains what makes Claude Sonnet 4.5 distinctive and how to use its advanced reasoning and extended thinking for complex professional tasks.

questions.question: What is Claude Sonnet 4.5 particularly optimized for?
choices: Simple, one-word answers
High-capability tasks requiring strong reasoning across complex work
Generating images and diagrams
Managing email inboxes
questions.explanation: Claude Sonnet 4.5 is designed for high-capability professional tasks, combining strong reasoning with broad knowledge to handle complex requests effectively.

questions.question: True or False: Claude Sonnet 4.5 can read and analyze uploaded files like PDFs and spreadsheets.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: Claude Sonnet 4.5 supports file uploads, allowing you to analyze PDFs, spreadsheets, images, and other documents directly within the conversation.

questions.question: Which feature allows Claude to remember your preferences and context across multiple conversations?
choices: Conversation history
Projects with custom instructions
The bookmarks tab
Auto-save settings
questions.explanation: Projects let you define custom instructions that Claude applies to every conversation within that project, effectively giving it persistent memory of your preferences.

topics.title: Core Features
topics.description: Master the four pillars of Claude.ai: Artifacts for creating content, Projects for persistent context, Connectors for external tools, and Skills for custom workflows.

videos.title: Intro to Artifacts
videos.reason: Official guide to creating and managing Artifacts — Claude's ability to produce standalone documents, code, and interactive web content alongside your conversation.

questions.question: What are Artifacts in Claude?
choices: Saved conversation summaries
Standalone outputs like code, documents, or interactive web pages created alongside the chat
Image files attached to messages
Shared team workspaces
questions.explanation: Artifacts are distinct, reusable outputs Claude creates alongside your conversation — they can be code files, documents, HTML pages, or interactive apps you can preview and iterate on.

questions.question: True or False: You can iterate on an Artifact multiple times without losing your conversation history.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: Artifacts are independent of the conversation thread, so you can refine them across many messages while keeping the full conversation history intact.

questions.question: Which of the following can Claude produce as an Artifact?
choices: A shareable public link to a website
An interactive HTML/JavaScript component you can preview instantly
A PDF with embedded video
A new user account
questions.explanation: Claude can create interactive HTML/JavaScript Artifacts that you can preview directly in the chat — perfect for prototyping dashboards, calculators, or simple tools.

videos.title: Intro to Projects
videos.reason: Shows how Projects let you set persistent instructions and share documents with Claude so it always has the right context for your work.

questions.question: What is the main benefit of using Projects in Claude?
choices: Sharing your conversations publicly
Maintaining persistent context and custom instructions across all chats in that project
Storing files permanently in the cloud
Inviting external collaborators to co-edit responses
questions.explanation: Projects allow you to define custom instructions and upload reference documents that Claude will remember and use across every conversation in that project.

questions.question: True or False: You can add documents and files to a Project for Claude to reference in conversations.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: Projects support adding files and documents as context. Claude will reference these automatically in all conversations within the project.

questions.question: How many Projects can you create in Claude?
choices: Only one
Up to five
As many as you need for different workflows
Only with a paid plan
questions.explanation: You can create as many Projects as needed, each with its own instructions, files, and context — for example, separate projects for different clients or teams.

videos.title: Intro to Connectors
videos.reason: Introduces Connectors — the feature that links Claude to your external tools like Google Drive and GitHub so it can work with your real data.

questions.question: What do Connectors in Claude allow you to do?
choices: Connect Claude to other AI models
Link Claude to external tools like Google Drive or GitHub to work with your real data
Export conversations to email automatically
Schedule automated tasks on a calendar
questions.explanation: Connectors extend Claude's reach by giving it secure, authorized access to your external tools and data sources so it can reference live information.

questions.question: True or False: Using a Connector, Claude can directly access files stored in your Google Drive.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: With the Google Drive Connector enabled, Claude can read your documents and spreadsheets to use as context — no manual copy-pasting required.

questions.question: What is required to activate a Connector in Claude?
choices: Installing a separate desktop application
Authorizing the integration in your Claude account settings
Purchasing an enterprise license
Contacting Anthropic support
questions.explanation: Connectors are set up in your Claude account settings — you authorize the integration once, and Claude can then securely access that tool going forward.

videos.title: How to create a skill with Claude through conversation
videos.reason: Demonstrates how to create Skills — reusable instruction sets that teach Claude to handle recurring tasks exactly the way you want them done.

questions.question: What is a Skill in Claude?
choices: A built-in Claude feature that requires no setup
A custom instruction set that teaches Claude to perform a specific task your preferred way
A certification badge earned after completing training
A type of Artifact for code
questions.explanation: Skills are reusable instruction sets you create to encode exactly how Claude should handle a recurring task — like writing in your brand voice or formatting reports your way.

questions.question: True or False: Skills can be created simply through a natural conversation with Claude.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: You describe the task and your preferences in conversation, and Claude formalizes them into a reusable Skill — no technical setup needed.

questions.question: How do you invoke a Skill once it has been created?
choices: Re-explain all instructions at the start of every chat
Reference the Skill by name in your prompt
It activates automatically for every message
Download and install it as a browser extension
questions.explanation: After creating a Skill, you simply mention its name in a prompt and Claude will apply those specific instructions to the task — no repetition needed.

videos.title: Teach Claude your way of working using skills
videos.reason: Shows how to encode your personal working preferences — tone, format, structure — into Skills so Claude consistently delivers results exactly how you like them.

questions.question: What kind of preferences can you encode into a Claude Skill?
choices: Your favorite color and music
Your writing style, preferred formats, and workflow conventions
Your device settings and time zone
Your calendar and meeting schedule
questions.explanation: Skills are designed to capture professional working preferences — tone, output structure, formatting rules — so Claude delivers consistently styled results.

questions.question: True or False: Skills are only available to users on paid Claude plans.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: Skills are a standard Claude feature available to users for personalizing recurring tasks, regardless of plan tier.

questions.question: Why are Skills more efficient than repeating instructions in every conversation?
choices: They make Claude respond significantly faster
They eliminate the need to re-explain your preferences each time
They grant Claude access to the internet
They increase Claude's token limit
questions.explanation: Skills encode your preferences once so Claude applies them consistently — removing the repetitive overhead of explaining your style at the start of every chat.

steps.title: Prompting & Communication
steps.summary: Learn the 4D Framework — Delegate, Describe, Discern, Diligence — and master the prompting techniques that separate average users from power users.
objectives: Apply the 4D Framework to every AI interaction
Write clear, specific prompts that get the results you need
Use few-shot prompting and iterative refinement effectively
Critically evaluate AI outputs and know when to push back
checklist: Memorize the four D's and their definitions
Rewrite a recent Claude prompt using the Describe best practices
Try few-shot prompting on a task relevant to your role
Identify one AI output this week where Discernment saved you from an error

topics.title: The 4D Framework
topics.description: Anthropic's structured framework for getting the most from AI: Delegate the right tasks, Describe them clearly, Discern what's useful, and apply Diligence to verify.

videos.title: Lesson 2B: The 4D Framework
videos.reason: Lesson 2B: The 4D Framework

questions.question: What are the four D's in the 4D Framework?
choices: Design, Develop, Deploy, Debug
Delegate, Describe, Discern, Diligence
Direct, Draft, Distribute, Document
Discover, Define, Deliver, Decide
questions.explanation: The 4D Framework: Delegate (assign the right tasks), Describe (provide clear context), Discern (critically evaluate), Diligence (verify and take responsibility).

questions.question: Which D involves providing Claude with clear context and instructions?
choices: Delegate
Describe
Discern
Diligence
questions.explanation: Description involves giving Claude the context, format, tone, and specific details it needs to produce useful output.

questions.question: What does "Discernment" help you do in the 4D Framework?
choices: Write better prompts
Critically evaluate AI outputs and decide what to keep or change
Share AI results with colleagues
Connect Claude to external tools
questions.explanation: Discernment is the skill of critically evaluating what Claude produces — identifying what's accurate, useful, and where human judgment should take precedence.

videos.title: Lesson 4: A closer look at Delegation
videos.reason: Lesson 4: A closer look at Delegation

questions.question: What does effective Delegation to Claude require?
choices: Giving Claude as little information as possible
Choosing tasks that match Claude's capabilities and providing clear direction
Delegating all tasks without any oversight
Only delegating creative writing tasks
questions.explanation: Effective delegation means identifying tasks Claude is well-suited for and providing enough context and direction for Claude to complete them well.

questions.question: Which element is most important to specify when delegating a task?
choices: The exact word count you want
The goal, context, and expected output format
Your personal preferences for font size
The number of revisions you plan to make
questions.explanation: Specifying the goal, context, and expected format dramatically improves delegation results.

questions.question: Which task is a strong candidate for delegating to Claude?
choices: Making a critical business decision requiring human accountability
Drafting a first version of a document based on notes you provide
Accessing private company databases
Conducting live video interviews
questions.explanation: Drafting documents is ideal for delegation — Claude handles the heavy lifting while you review, refine, and take accountability for the final version.

videos.title: Lesson 6: A closer look at Description
videos.reason: Lesson 6: A closer look at Description

questions.question: In the 4D Framework, what does "Description" refer to?
choices: Writing a description of the Claude interface
Providing Claude with clear context, goals, constraints, and format expectations
Describing your career background to Claude
The process of summarizing Claude's outputs
questions.explanation: Description means giving Claude a thorough brief: what you want, why you need it, what format works best, any constraints, and relevant context.

questions.question: How does providing more context in your prompt improve Claude's responses?
choices: It makes responses shorter
It helps Claude understand your intent and tailor output to your specific needs
It forces Claude to be more creative
It has no meaningful effect on output quality
questions.explanation: Context helps Claude understand who you are, what you're trying to achieve, and what constraints apply — leading to more relevant, accurate responses.

questions.question: Which is most important to include when describing a task to Claude?
choices: A list of words Claude should never use
Your role, goal, and the format you need for the output
The exact date and time of your request
The names of all team members involved
questions.explanation: Describing your role, goal, and desired format are the three most impactful description elements.

topics.title: Advanced Prompting
topics.description: Deep dive into effective prompting techniques, how to iterate on prompts, and how to apply Discernment to evaluate and improve Claude's outputs.

videos.title: Lesson 7: Effective prompting techniques (Deep Dive)
videos.reason: Lesson 7: Effective prompting techniques (Deep Dive)

questions.question: What is the most important factor in writing an effective prompt?
choices: Using technical jargon
Being clear and specific about what you want and why
Making the prompt as short as possible
Using formal language only
questions.explanation: Clarity and specificity are the foundations of effective prompting. The more precisely you communicate your goal, the better Claude's response.

questions.question: Which technique involves providing Claude with examples of the output you want?
choices: Chain-of-thought prompting
Few-shot prompting
Zero-shot prompting
System prompting
questions.explanation: Few-shot prompting means including one or more examples to show Claude exactly the style, format, or type of output you expect.

questions.question: What is the best approach when Claude's first response isn't what you needed?
choices: Start over with a completely new conversation
Refine your prompt with more specific instructions and context
Accept the response as-is
Switch to a different AI tool
questions.explanation: Prompting is iterative. Provide more context, clarify your intent, or specify what was missing — Claude responds well to follow-up instructions.

videos.title: Lesson 8: A closer look at Discernment
videos.reason: Lesson 8: A closer look at Discernment

questions.question: What does "Discernment" mean in the 4D Framework?
choices: The ability to write better prompts
Critically evaluating AI outputs to decide what is accurate and useful
The speed at which you use AI tools
The process of delegating tasks to AI
questions.explanation: Discernment is the capacity to critically assess AI outputs — identifying what's accurate, what needs verification, and where human judgment should override the AI.

questions.question: Why is critical evaluation of AI outputs particularly important?
choices: Because AI is always correct
Because AI can produce confident-sounding but inaccurate information
Because AI outputs are always incomplete
Because AI is too conservative in its responses
questions.explanation: AI models can generate plausible-sounding incorrect information. Critical evaluation helps catch errors before they cause harm.

questions.question: What should you do when you're unsure if Claude's answer is accurate?
choices: Trust it since AI is more reliable than humans
Verify with authoritative sources or subject-matter experts
Ask Claude the same question again
Ignore the response entirely
questions.explanation: When in doubt, verify AI outputs using reliable external sources or consult domain experts before acting on the information.

videos.title: Lesson 11: Conclusion
videos.reason: Lesson 11: Conclusion

questions.question: What is the main takeaway from the AI Fluency course?
choices: AI will soon replace all knowledge work
Effective AI collaboration requires applying the 4D Framework consistently
You should avoid AI tools in professional settings
AI tools work best with minimal human involvement
questions.explanation: The AI Fluency course teaches that effective AI collaboration is a skill built on the 4D Framework — applied consistently across all tasks.

questions.question: How does the 4D Framework help you work effectively with AI?
choices: By automating all your tasks
By providing a structured approach to assigning, briefing, evaluating, and verifying AI work
By teaching you to code AI models
By eliminating the need for human review
questions.explanation: The 4D Framework provides a structured, repeatable process: delegate the right tasks, describe them clearly, discern what's useful, apply diligence to verify.

questions.question: What is the recommended mindset for continuing your AI journey after this course?
choices: Learn AI tools once and never change your approach
Experiment, reflect, and continuously refine how you collaborate with AI
Avoid using AI until it becomes more reliable
Use AI only for tasks you already know well
questions.explanation: AI Fluency is a continuous practice. The best practitioners experiment with new approaches and adapt as AI tools evolve.

steps.title: Claude at Work
steps.summary: Apply Claude across professional tasks — writing, research, data analysis, document workflows, and role-specific use cases.
objectives: Use Claude to write, research, and analyze data faster and better
Automate document workflows: slides, spreadsheets, contracts, Excel
Identify workflow augmentation opportunities in your own role
Apply Claude to role-specific tasks in engineering, HR, marketing, product, or sales
checklist: Use Claude to draft or rewrite one professional document this week
Ask Claude to help with a research task and verify its output
Try Claude on a spreadsheet or Excel formula challenge
Watch the video for your specific role

topics.title: Core Professional Skills
topics.description: Master writing, researching, analyzing data, and augmenting your workflow with AI — the four skills that apply to every professional role.

videos.title: Writing with AI
videos.reason: Writing with AI

questions.question: What writing tasks can AI tools like Claude assist with most effectively?
choices: Only creative fiction
Drafting, editing, summarizing, and transforming text across many formats
Only technical documentation
Only social media posts
questions.explanation: Claude excels at drafting, editing, summarizing, and transforming written content — from emails and reports to proposals and presentations.

questions.question: How should you use AI-generated drafts in your writing process?
choices: Publish them directly without review
As a starting point that you refine, edit, and personalize
Only for internal documents
Replace your own writing entirely
questions.explanation: AI drafts are best used as a starting point — they handle the heavy lifting while you refine, personalize, and ensure accuracy.

questions.question: What is the recommended approach when using AI for professional writing?
choices: Copy and paste all AI output without changes
Provide clear context and style guidance, then review and personalize the output
Use AI only for brainstorming, never for actual writing
Ask AI to write without giving it any examples
questions.explanation: Give Claude clear context about tone, audience, and purpose. Then review, edit, and add your personal touch to the final output.

videos.title: Researching with AI
videos.reason: Researching with AI

questions.question: What is the most effective use of AI for research tasks?
choices: Replacing all traditional research methods
Synthesizing information, identifying patterns, and generating research frameworks
Finding the single correct answer to any question
Replacing peer-reviewed academic sources
questions.explanation: AI is most valuable in research for synthesizing large amounts of information, identifying connections, and helping structure research frameworks.

questions.question: Why is it important to verify AI-provided research information?
choices: Because AI intentionally provides false information
Because AI may hallucinate facts or have an outdated knowledge cutoff
Because AI responses are always too long
Because AI only knows about technology topics
questions.explanation: AI models can generate plausible but inaccurate citations or facts, and their knowledge has a training cutoff date. Always cross-reference key claims.

questions.question: How can you maximize the quality of AI-assisted research?
choices: Ask only yes/no questions
Provide specific context, ask follow-up questions, and verify key claims
Accept all AI outputs as authoritative
Avoid using AI for research entirely
questions.explanation: Quality AI research requires specific prompts, iterative follow-up questions, and verification of key claims — treating AI as a collaborator, not an oracle.

videos.title: Data analysis with AI
videos.reason: Data analysis with AI

questions.question: What type of data analysis tasks can Claude assist with effectively?
choices: Only statistical modeling in Python
Summarizing datasets, identifying trends, generating insights, and structuring reports
Only building machine learning models
Only data entry and formatting
questions.explanation: Claude can summarize datasets, identify patterns, generate insights, structure reports, and suggest analytical approaches.

questions.question: What should you always do after using AI to analyze data?
choices: Share it immediately with your entire team
Validate key findings against the source data using your own expertise
Delete the original data
Never question the AI's conclusions
questions.explanation: AI-generated data analysis should always be validated against the source data using domain expertise before presenting conclusions.

questions.question: How can you use Claude to better understand a complex dataset?
choices: Upload raw data and ask Claude to make all decisions
Describe the dataset and ask Claude to suggest key questions, patterns, and analysis approaches
Ask Claude to fetch data from your database automatically
Use Claude only for creating charts
questions.explanation: Describing your dataset and asking Claude to suggest analytical questions and patterns helps structure your analysis effectively.

videos.title: Workflow augmentation
videos.reason: Workflow augmentation

questions.question: What does "workflow augmentation" with AI mean?
choices: Replacing your entire workflow with automation
Integrating AI into specific steps of your existing processes to improve speed and quality
Using AI only for tasks you don't know how to do
Eliminating all manual work from your job

topics.title: Introduction to Claude Code
topics.description: Understand what Claude Code is, how it works on the web, what skills are, and how they compare to other Claude Code features.

videos.title: Claude Code on the web
videos.reason: Claude Code on the web

questions.question: What does "Claude Code on the web" allow you to do?
choices: Access Claude only through a mobile app
Use Claude's agentic coding capabilities directly in your web browser
Download Claude to your local computer
Run Claude Code offline without internet
questions.explanation: Claude Code on the web brings Claude's coding capabilities to the browser — enabling software development workflows without a local terminal installation.

questions.question: How does Claude Code differ from the standard Claude.ai chat interface?
choices: Claude Code is only for design tasks
Claude Code is specialized for software development with tools to read, write, and execute code
Claude Code doesn't support conversation
Claude Code is identical to Claude.ai
questions.explanation: Claude Code goes beyond conversation — it can read and write files, run commands, manage codebases, and take agentic actions to complete software development tasks end-to-end.

questions.question: What types of coding tasks is Claude Code best suited for?
choices: Only writing CSS styles
Code generation, debugging, refactoring, writing tests, and codebase navigation
Only building mobile apps
Only data science tasks
questions.explanation: Claude Code excels at a broad range of software tasks: writing new code, debugging, refactoring, generating tests, explaining codebases, and more.

videos.title: What are skills?
videos.reason: What are skills?

questions.question: In Claude Code, what is a "skill"?
choices: A certification you earn after completing training
A reusable, pre-defined instruction set that teaches Claude how to perform a specific task
A Claude.ai Projects feature
A type of Artifact
questions.explanation: In Claude Code, skills are reusable instruction sets stored as files that define how Claude should approach specific tasks — like a specialized tool you can invoke by name.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of creating skills in Claude Code?
choices: To make Claude Code more expensive
To standardize and reuse complex instructions across multiple projects and sessions
To limit what Claude Code can do
To replace writing code entirely
questions.explanation: Skills let you define complex instructions once and reuse them across projects — ensuring consistency and saving time compared to re-explaining workflows every session.

questions.question: How do skills help you work more efficiently with Claude Code?
choices: They run code automatically without any input
They eliminate the need to repeat detailed instructions, making workflows faster and more consistent
They give Claude internet access
They connect Claude to external APIs automatically
questions.explanation: Skills remove the need to repeatedly type out the same detailed instructions — define a workflow once, then invoke it by name whenever you need it.

videos.title: How skills compare to other Claude Code features
videos.reason: How skills compare to other Claude Code features

questions.question: How do skills differ from regular conversational prompts in Claude Code?
choices: Skills are shorter than prompts
Skills are persistent, reusable files while prompts are one-time conversational inputs
Skills only work once
There is no difference between skills and prompts
questions.explanation: Skills are stored as files that persist across sessions and can be reused repeatedly, while prompts are conversational inputs that need to be re-typed each time.

questions.question: When should you create a skill rather than using a regular Claude Code prompt?
choices: For one-off tasks you'll never repeat
For complex, recurring workflows that you want to standardize and reuse
When your prompts are very short
When you want Claude to forget the instructions after each use
questions.explanation: Create a skill when you have a complex workflow you'll run repeatedly — turning instructions into a reusable skill saves time and ensures consistent results.

questions.question: What advantage do skills have over writing instructions each time?
choices: Skills are always faster than typed prompts
Skills provide consistency, reusability, and can be shared across a team
Skills cost less to use
Skills bypass Claude's safety guidelines
questions.explanation: Skills ensure consistent results from the same workflow, can be reused without re-typing, and shared with teammates — creating a library of proven instructions.

topics.title: Building with Skills
topics.description: Create, configure, share, and troubleshoot Claude Code skills — turning repetitive workflows into reusable, team-shareable tools.

videos.title: Creating your first skill
videos.reason: Creating your first skill

questions.question: What is the first step to creating a skill in Claude Code?
choices: Installing a plugin
Creating a skill file (e.g., in .claude/skills/) that describes the task and its steps
Asking Claude to generate a skill automatically
Purchasing a Claude Code subscription
questions.explanation: Creating a skill starts with defining a skill file — typically in a .claude/skills/ directory — that describes what the skill does and the steps Claude should follow.

questions.question: What makes a well-written skill definition?
choices: Being as vague as possible so Claude has flexibility
Clear, specific instructions with context about the task's goal, steps, and expected output
Using only code, no natural language
Limiting the skill to a single sentence
questions.explanation: Good skill definitions are clear and specific — they explain the task's purpose, list the steps to follow, specify the expected output format, and provide necessary context.

questions.question: After creating a skill file, how do you use it in a Claude Code session?
choices: Claude detects and runs it automatically
You invoke the skill by name or reference in your conversation with Claude Code
You must restart your computer first
You email the skill to Anthropic for activation
questions.explanation: Once defined, invoke the skill by referring to it by name in your Claude Code session — Claude will then follow the skill's defined instructions.

videos.title: Configuration and multi-file skills
videos.reason: Configuration and multi-file skills

questions.question: What does skill configuration in Claude Code allow you to customize?
choices: The color of the Claude Code interface
Parameters, behavior, and context specific to each skill
The programming language Claude uses
The number of tokens Claude generates
questions.explanation: Skill configuration lets you define parameters and settings specific to each skill — enabling the same skill to be adapted for different contexts.

questions.question: What is the advantage of using multi-file skills in Claude Code?
choices: They run faster than single-file skills
They allow complex workflows to be broken into modular, maintainable components
They require less disk space
They are the only way to share skills with others
questions.explanation: Multi-file skills let you organize complex workflows into modular components — each file handling a specific part — making skills easier to maintain and understand.

questions.question: How do you organize skills across multiple files in Claude Code?
choices: Store all skills in a single text document
Create a structured directory (e.g., .claude/skills/) with separate files for each skill or component
Email skill files to your team members
Store skills only in environment variables
questions.explanation: Organizing skills in a structured directory with separate files keeps your workflow library clean, navigable, and maintainable.

videos.title: Sharing skills
videos.reason: Sharing skills

questions.question: How can you share a skill with your team in Claude Code?
choices: Skills cannot be shared between users
By committing skill files to a shared code repository (e.g., Git)
By emailing Anthropic support
By using a special export button in Claude Code
questions.explanation: Since skills are files, they can be shared through version control systems like Git — committing them to a shared repository makes them available to the whole team.

questions.question: What should you include when sharing a skill with colleagues?
choices: Only the skill file name
The skill file, a description of what it does, how to invoke it, and any prerequisites
Your API key
Only the commands it uses
questions.explanation: Shared skills should include the skill file itself, documentation on what it does, how to invoke it, and setup requirements.

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of sharing skills across a team?
choices: It reduces the cost of Claude subscriptions
It creates a shared library of proven workflows, ensuring consistency across the team
It makes Claude faster for everyone
It gives all team members admin access
questions.explanation: A shared skill library ensures all team members benefit from proven, tested workflows — reducing duplication and spreading best practices.

videos.title: Troubleshooting skills
videos.reason: Troubleshooting skills

questions.question: What is the most common reason a Claude Code skill fails to work as expected?
choices: The skill file is too large
Unclear or ambiguous instructions in the skill definition
Claude Code is offline
The skill has too many steps
questions.explanation: Most skill failures stem from unclear or ambiguous instructions. Clarity in the skill definition is critical for consistent results.

questions.question: How should you debug a skill that produces unexpected results?
choices: Delete the skill and start from scratch immediately
Test individual steps, add more specificity, and iterate on the skill definition
Report the issue to Anthropic support only
Blame the model and switch to a different AI tool
questions.explanation: Debug skills by breaking them down — test individual steps in isolation, add more specific instructions where Claude's behavior diverges, and iterate until the skill works correctly.

questions.question: What should you check first when a skill doesn't execute properly?
choices: The color theme of your code editor
The skill file syntax, its location in the directory, and whether instructions are clear
Whether you have the latest version of macOS
The number of tokens in your conversation
questions.explanation: Start troubleshooting by checking the basics: is the skill file correctly formatted, in the right location, and do the instructions clearly describe what Claude should do?
